German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German snel, from Old High German snel (“nimble, brave, quick, lively”), from Proto-Germanic *snellaz (“active, bold, quick”). Cognate with Dutch snel, English snell. More at snell.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ʃnɛl/
  • Rhymes: -ɛl
  • audio (Germany)
    		(file)
  • audio (Austria)
    		(file)

Adjective[edit]

schnell (comparative schneller, superlative am schnellsten)

  1. quick, fast

Derived terms[edit]

Derived terms
  • blitzschnell
  • Schnelligkeit
  • Schnellspanner
  • Schnellzug
  • sekundenschnell

Adverb[edit]

schnell

  1. quickly
  2. again; quick; used after a question to imply that one ought to know the answer
    Wie heißt er schnell?
    What’s his name again?

Synonyms[edit]

  • (again): (doch) gleich; noch (mal)

Antonyms[edit]

  • langsam

Derived terms[edit]

  • sag schnell

Further reading[edit]

  • schnell in Duden online

Hunsrik[edit]

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ʃnel/

Adjective[edit]

schnell

  1. fast, quick, swift

Derived terms[edit]

  • Schnellichkeet

Further reading[edit]

  • Online Hunsrik Dictionary

Luxembourgish[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Old High German snel, from Proto-Germanic *snellaz. Cognate with German schnell, English snell, Dutch snel.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ʃnæl/
  • Rhymes: -æl
  • Audio
    		(file)

Adjective[edit]

schnell (masculine schnellen, neuter schnellt, comparative méi schnell, superlative am schnellsten)

  1. fast, quick, swift

Declension[edit]

declension of schnell
number and gendersingularplural
masculinefeminineneuterall genders
predicativehien ass schnellsi ass schnellet ass schnellsi si(nn) schnell
without articlenominative/accusativeschnellenschnellschnelltschnell
dativeschnellemschnellerschnellemschnellen
with articlenominative/accusativeschnellenschnellschnelltschnell
dativeschnellenschnellerschnellenschnellen

Synonyms[edit]

  • flott
  • huerteg
  • schëtzeg
  • séier
